item.title: 'Prison For Starmer': Elon Musk Takes Another Dig At British PM Over His Old Islamophobia Remark - News18
item.description:
Elon Musk Criticizes UK PM Starmer Over Child Exploitation Scandal

Date: January 06, 2025 Source: News18

Elon Musk has launched a significant critique against British Prime Minister Keir Starmer, accusing him of neglecting his responsibilities during his tenure as Director of Public Prosecutions regarding child sexual exploitation cases.

  • Musk has highlighted the government’s inaction on child sexual exploitation during Starmer's leadership.
  • The criticism intensified following a stabbing incident in Southport that resulted in the deaths of three children.
  • Musk shared a video of Starmer condemning Islamophobia, questioning his stance while violent crimes were occurring.
  • Protests erupted across England following the Southport attack, fueled by misinformation about the assailant's background.
  • Government ministers condemned Musk's statements as misjudged and misinformed.
“Prison for Starmer.” - Elon Musk

The discourse surrounding these events raises questions about accountability and the political response to social issues in the UK.

item.title: Bangladesh issues second arrest warrant against Sheikh Hasina - The Times of India
item.description:
Bangladesh Issues Second Arrest Warrant Against Sheikh Hasina

Date: October 2023 Source: The Times of India

Bangladesh has issued a second arrest warrant for Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in connection with a political case involving allegations of corruption and electoral misconduct. The political turmoil continues to escalate as protests intensify.

  • The warrant is linked to ongoing political controversies surrounding Sheikh Hasina's government.
  • Protests and civil unrest have been reported in major cities as opposition parties mobilize their supporters.
  • International observers are monitoring the situation closely amid concerns for democratic practices in the country.

item.title: Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise - NDTV
item.description:
Global HMPV Tracker: Karnataka, Maharashtra Issue Guidelines As Cases Rise

Date: Not specified; Source: Not specified

The Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) is spreading globally, causing health concerns and prompting monitoring in various countries. In India, two cases have been reported in Bengaluru, with health authorities responding accordingly.

  • HMPV has flu-like symptoms and is similar to Covid-19.
  • Two cases reported in Bengaluru; a 3-month-old has been discharged and an 8-month-old is recovering.
  • Neither patient had a history of international travel.
  • Young children, the elderly, and those with weakened immune systems are most vulnerable to HMPV.
  • Health authorities are closely monitoring developments in the context of seasonal respiratory illnesses in China.
According to the US Centre for Disease Control, HMPV causes upper and lower respiratory infections.

This situation highlights the importance of vigilance and response from health authorities to manage the spread of respiratory illnesses like HMPV.

item.title: From liquor seller and bike mechanic to a journalist with thriving YouTube channel, Mukesh Chandrakar’s story was one of perseverance - The Indian Express
item.description:
Mukesh Chandrakar: A Journalist's Journey of Perseverance Cut Short

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

Mukesh Chandrakar, a 32-year-old journalist from Chhattisgarh, transitioned from selling liquor and being a bike mechanic to a respected journalist known for his YouTube channel. Sadly, his life was tragically cut short by relatives angered by his work.

  • Mukesh was born in Basaguda, Chhattisgarh, during a violent era caused by armed militias and Maoists.
  • His family faced hardship, with his mother raising Mukesh and his brother after their father's death.
  • He was inspired to pursue journalism after seeing his brother's work and made a name for covering Naxal territory encounters.
  • Mukesh's YouTube channel, Bastar Junction, gained 166,000 subscribers and increased his income significantly.
  • He faced threats from both government and Maoists for his reporting, yet remained committed to informing the public.
  • His death allegedly stems from a report criticizing a road contract involving his cousin.
“If one core principle of journalism is to inform, to reach new areas, to give voice to the voiceless, journalists like Mukesh are peerless.”

This tragic ending highlights the dangers journalists face in challenging environments, underscoring the need for support in protective measures for media professionals.

item.title: ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
ITC Hotels Demerger Live Updates: ITC shares trade ex-hotels; discovered price at ₹455.60 on NSE

Date: 06 Jan 2025

Source: LiveMint

ITC Hotels demerger record date was today, and the discovered price of ITC shares during a special trading session on the NSE is ₹455.60 apiece.

  • ITC shares are trading ex-hotels as the demerger record date has formally been executed.
  • The stock was adjusted by ₹26 or 5.4% at ₹455.60 on NSE.
  • ITC Hotels demerger ratio is 1:10, meaning shareholders receive one share of ITC Hotels for every ten ITC shares held.
  • The listing date for ITC Hotels will be announced soon.
  • Expectations for ITC Hotels listing price range between ₹100-170 based on peer valuations.
“The demerger is expected to unlock substantial shareholder value and allow ITC Hotels to focus on growth.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

This demerger is a significant event for ITC Ltd shareholders, as it allows for direct investment in the growing hotel sector.

item.title: Paatal Lok season 2 trailer: Inspector Hathiram, ‘Sir’ Imran Ansari enter big leagues; Jaideep Ahlawat is so watchable - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Paatal Lok Season 2 Trailer: Hathi Ram battles personal demons while probing a migrant worker's disappearance.

Date: Jan 06, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The trailer for the upcoming second season of Paatal Lok shows Inspector Hathiram Chaudhary and IPS officer Imran Ansari teaming up for a challenging case centered around the disappearance of a migrant worker.

  • Hathiram is forced to confront personal demons while navigating a web of secrets.
  • New case takes place in Nagaland.
  • Show is directed by Avinash Arun Dhaware and produced by Clean Slate Filmz.
  • Digging deeper into Hathiram's character and moral dilemmas.
“Paatal Lok Season 1 was a milestone in my career, and the overwhelming love it received still humbles me,” said actor Jaideep Ahlawat.

The show will premiere on January 17 on Amazon Prime Video.

item.title: Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India - The Hindu
item.description:
Redmi 14C 5G launched with 120 Hz refresh rate and Snapdragon processor for budget buyers in India

Date & Source: January 06, 2025 - The Hindu

Xiaomi has introduced its first smartphone of 2025, the budget-friendly Redmi 14C 5G, offering impressive specifications and features for cost-conscious consumers.

  • 6.88 inch HD+ punch hole display with 120 Hz refresh rate.
  • Powered by Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor with options up to 6 GB RAM and 128 GB storage.
  • Equipped with a 5,160 mAh battery with 33 W charger and supports 18 W charging.
  • Features a 50 MP camera and an 8 MP front camera.
  • Prices start at ₹9,999 for the base model, with the device available in three colors.
  • Sales begin on January 10 through various online platforms.
Xiaomi has priced the Redmi 14C 5G at ₹9,999 for 4 GB/64 GB, while the 4 GB/128 GB model will sell for ₹10,999 and the 6 GB/128 GB at ₹11,999.

The Redmi 14C 5G is positioned as a compelling option in the budget smartphone segment, offering high specifications at an accessible price.

item.title: Realme 14 Pro 5G Series India Launch Set For January 16; Key Features Surface via Leaked Posters - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Realme 14 Pro 5G Series India Launch Date Confirmed; Key Features Leaked

Date: January 16, 2024

Source: Gadgets 360

The Realme 14 Pro 5G series is set to launch in India on January 16, 2024. The company has disclosed significant features and leaked specifications through promotional materials.

  • The series will feature a base model and a Plus variant.
  • Confirmed colors include Pearl White, Suede Grey, Bikaner Purple, and Jaipur Pink.
  • It boasts the slimmest bezels in its segment and the world's first triple flash unit.
  • Both models will be equipped with 6,000mAh batteries with various fast charging capabilities (45W for base and 80W for Plus).
  • The main camera of the base model will feature a 50MP Sony IMX882 sensor; the Plus variant will have additional camera specifications.
“The Realme 14 Pro will include an OIS-supported 50-megapixel primary sensor with 4K video recording support.”

In conclusion, the Realme 14 Pro 5G series promises innovative features and design, appealing to tech enthusiasts in India.

item.title: ​6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope ​ - Times Now
item.description:
6 Amazing Pictures Of Interacting Galaxies Captured By NASA Telescope

Date: Jan 6, 2025 Source: Times Now

This article showcases stunning images of interacting galaxies captured by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting their unique features and beauty.

  • Image of NGC 7049 showing a collection of globular clusters.
  • Portrait of Stephan’s Quintet, a group of five galaxies including a foreground galaxy.
  • NGC 5128 known for its dramatic dark lanes of dusty material.
  • NGC 3717, a beautiful spiral galaxy located about 60 million light-years away.
  • NGC 1316, depicting the results of a merger between two galaxies.
  • Arp 148 showing a ring-shaped galaxy involved in a collision.
“It has intricate loops and blobs of cosmic dust, evidence of past galactic mergers.”

This collection of images emphasizes the complexity and dynamic nature of our universe as seen through NASA's advanced technologies.

item.title: Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers - Upstox
item.description:
Markets extend losses: NIFTY50 and SENSEX fall over 1%, HDFC Bank, Kotak Bank and Reliance among top index movers

Date: January 6, 2023 | Source: Financial News

Indian equity benchmarks extended morning losses in the mid-market session, with foreign portfolio investors continuing their selling spree as traders awaited Q3 earnings season cues.

The main points highlighted in this article include:

  • Foreign institutional investors sold ₹4,227.25 crore in capital markets on Friday.
  • SENSEX traded down by 0.95% at 78530.57, while NIFTY50 fell 1.01% to 23764.85.
  • The broader indices were also in decline; BSE mid-cap down 1.27%, small-cap down 1.64%.
  • HDFC Bank shares dropped due to slowed credit growth updates.
  • Titan shares rallied over 2% backed by strong Q3FY25 growth, with a 24% YoY revenue increase.
  • Asian markets mostly traded in the red, with some noteworthy declines in major indices.
“Investors are wary of taking on more risk in light of looming US-China trade tensions.”

This article provides insight into the cautious sentiment prevailing in the Indian stock markets, primarily driven by foreign selling and awaiting the upcoming earnings reports.

item.title: India Suffer Big Jasprit Bumrah Blow Ahead Of England Series, Report Says Pacer To Miss... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Likely to Miss England Series Due to Back Injury

Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV

India's pace spearhead Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss a significant portion of the upcoming white-ball series against England due to back spasms. The decision to rest him aims to ensure his recovery ahead of the ICC Champions Trophy starting February 19.

  • Bumrah was instrumental in the recently concluded Border-Gavaskar Trophy, taking 32 wickets.
  • Concerns arise from his high workload during the series, where he bowled over 150 overs.
  • The BCCI medical team is assessing the severity of his injury to plan recovery.
  • If classified as a Grade 1 injury, Bumrah could be sidelined for 2-3 weeks, while Grade 2 could mean a 6-week recovery.
  • India is scheduled to face England in five T20Is and three ODIs starting January 22.
“His presence is mandatory to India's fortunes,” sources say about Bumrah's role in the Champions Trophy.

The outcome of the injury assessment will determine Bumrah's participation in the series against England and his fitness for the upcoming matches.

item.title: Flipkart Offer: Smart TVs Available Under Just Rs 9,000 – Hurry! Grab THESE Best Deals At Half Price NOW - News24
item.description:
Flipkart Offer: Smart TVs Available Under Just Rs 9,000 – Hurry! Grab THESE Best Deals At Half Price NOW

Date: January 06, 2025 | Source: News24

Flipkart is presenting fantastic deals on 32-inch smart TVs, all priced below INR 9,000, with discounts reaching up to 57%. Here are the top picks of the best deals available:

  • Infinix 32-inch HD Ready LED Smart TV: Price: INR 8,499 (originally INR 16,999), with EMI discounts available.
  • KODAK Special Edition 32-inch HD Ready LED Smart TV: Price after up to 44% discount, with EMI discounts available.
  • TCL 32-inch HD Ready LED Smart Android TV: Price: INR 8,990 (originally INR 20,990), featuring an incredible 57% discount.

As the festive season approaches, these deals present an excellent opportunity for upgrading your entertainment setup.

“A brilliant blend of affordability and superior technology is literally at your fingertips.”

item.title: 2 Babies Diagnosed With HMPV Virus In Bengaluru, No Travel History: Centre - NDTV
item.description:
Two Babies Diagnosed With HMPV Virus In Bengaluru

Publication Date: Today Source: The Centre

The report highlights two cases of Human Metapneumovirus (HMPV) in Bengaluru, marking the first occurrences in India. One of the infants has been discharged, while the other is still recovering.

  • 3-month-old and 8-month-old babies diagnosed with HMPV.
  • No recent travel history for affected families.
  • HMPV monitoring initiated by ICMR and related health bodies.
  • Health Ministry convened a meeting for preparedness against HMPV.
  • The virus can lead to mild respiratory symptoms but may cause serious complications.
“Both cases were identified through routine surveillance for multiple respiratory viral pathogens...” - Centre statement

The monitoring of HMPV and respiratory viruses is crucial, especially in light of the increase in respiratory illnesses observed in other regions.

item.title: Meta moves NCLAT against ₹213.14 crore CCI penalty over WhatsApp privacy policy - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Meta Appeals ₹213.14 Crore CCI Penalty Over WhatsApp Privacy Policy

Published on: 06 Jan 2025, 5:53 am

Meta Platforms Inc has filed an appeal with the NCLAT against a ₹213.14 crore penalty imposed by the CCI for abuses related to its WhatsApp privacy policy.

  1. Meta is contesting a CCI penalty regarding its WhatsApp privacy policy.
  2. The penalty amounts to ₹213.14 crore for abusing market dominance.
  3. Senior Advocates Kapil Sibal and Mukul Rohatgi are representing Meta and WhatsApp.
  4. The NCLAT is set to hear the case on January 16.
  5. The CCI found that WhatsApp's 2021 policy violated the Competition Act.
  6. Citing a 'take-it-or-leave-it' approach, the CCI deemed user autonomy undermined.

“The order has huge implications. We request your lordships to take it up yourself.”

In conclusion, the outcome of this case may have significant ramifications for WhatsApp and the broader tech industry regarding data sharing practices.

item.title: Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Stock market crash: Sensex cracks 1200 points, Nifty 50 below 23,700; HMPV virus scare among 5 factors behind selloff

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market witnessed a significant crash on Monday, with both Sensex and Nifty 50 indices falling over a percent due to investor fears sparked by a new virus outbreak in China. The Sensex dropped over 1,100 points, while Nifty 50 slipped below the 23,700 mark.

  • Sectoral indices, including Nifty PSU Bank and Nifty Realty, experienced major losses.
  • Top losers included Tata Steel, BPCL, and Adani Enterprises.
  • The fall attributed to weak Asian markets, a virus outbreak, heavy losses in index heavyweights, strength of the US dollar, and broken technical support levels.
“Nifty holds a good view until it stays above its 200 DMA which is placed at 23,900.” - Prashanth Tapse, Senior VP (Research), Mehta Equities Ltd.

Analysts suggest caution as the market reacts to geopolitical uncertainties and technical resistance levels.

item.title: CES 2025: Samsung unveils AI-powered Neo QLED TVs, The Frame Pro, and more - Business Standard
item.description:
Samsung Unveils AI-Powered Neo QLED TVs and Innovative Devices at CES 2025

Publication Date: Jan 06 2025 | Source: Business Standard

At CES 2025 in Las Vegas, Samsung introduced a new lineup of AI-enhanced devices, including the Neo QLED TV, The Frame Pro, and a series of projectors, showcasing advancements in home entertainment technology.

  • Samsung launched its 2025 TV line-up featuring new Neo QLED, OLED, and QLED models.
  • The flagship Neo QLED 8K QN990F TV employs Vision AI features for enhanced viewing experience.
  • The Frame Pro enhances artwork display quality while introducing new content from famous estates.
  • New interactive projector called The Premiere 5 with advanced features for user engagement.
  • Samsung's Ballie robots returned, with enhanced capabilities including a built-in projector.
“Samsung said that the new flagship TV model blends cutting-edge technology with an ultra-slim, minimalist design.”

Samsung's innovations at CES 2025 highlight their commitment to integrating AI into consumer electronics, pushing the boundaries of how users experience home entertainment.

item.title: Emergency trailer: Kangana Ranaut's Indira Gandhi declares herself the Cabinet, film aims to show untold history. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Emergency trailer: Kangana Ranaut's Indira Gandhi declares herself the Cabinet, film aims to show untold history

Date: Jan 06, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The trailer for the film Emergency, featuring Kangana Ranaut as former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi, has been released. The trailer portrays key historical events during the Emergency period in India.

  • Kangana portrays Indira Gandhi declaring herself the Cabinet.
  • Anupam Kher plays Jayaprakash Narayan, who communicates with Gandhi from jail.
  • The film depicts portrayal of violence and chaos during the Emergency.
  • Kangana tweeted about the film highlighting the historical significance of the Emergency and Gandhi's influence.
  • Other cast members include Shreyas Talpade as Atal Bihari Vajpayee and Mahima Chaudhry as Pupul Jayakar.
  • The film is set to release on January 17, 2025.
“1975, Emergency — A Defining chapter in Indian History. Indira: India’s most powerful woman. Her ambition transformed the nation, but her #EMERGENCY plunged it into chaos.” - Kangana Ranaut

The movie aims to offer a deep dive into the political climate and events during one of India's most tumultuous periods.

item.title: Bastar journalist murder: Prime accused Suresh Chandrakar arrested by SIT in Hyderabad - The Times of India
item.description:
Bastar journalist murder: Prime accused Suresh Chandrakar arrested by SIT in Hyderabad

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

The prime accused in the murder of a journalist in Bastar has been arrested by the Special Investigation Team (SIT) in Hyderabad. This significant development comes after an extensive investigation into the case.

  • The arrest was made amid rising concerns over journalist safety.
  • Suresh Chandrakar was identified as a key suspect in the ongoing investigations.
  • The SIT has been working to uncover the motives behind the journalist's murder.
“This arrest is a step towards justice for the affected family and the journalist community.” - A spokesperson for the SIT

This case highlights the ongoing threats faced by journalists in vulnerable regions and the importance of accountability in such cases.

item.title: High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
High drama outside Telangana ACB office as KTR refuses to go in without lawyer, calls CM Revanth Reddy ‘third-rate criminal’

Publication Date: Monday

Source: [Your News Source]

On Monday morning, K T Rama Rao, the working president of Bharat Rashtra Samiti, found himself in a standoff with the Telangana Anti Corruption Bureau. He refused to enter the ACB office without his lawyer present, leading to significant drama outside the agency’s premises.

  • KTR stated that the ACB barred his lawyer from attending while his statement was recorded.
  • After 45 minutes in their vehicle, KTR left without giving his statement, having submitted a lawyer's response to the ACB notice.
  • He asserted his right to have legal representation during questioning, citing concerns over trust towards the ACB and past incidents involving other politicians.
  • The ACB had summoned him regarding the Formula E race case, linked to an alleged financial transfer to a foreign company.
  • KTR has challenged the ACB's FIR against him in the High Court, which has yet to issue a ruling.
“I do not trust this government and the police are acting under the instructions of a third-rate criminal like Revanth Reddy,” KTR claimed.

The situation has raised questions about legal rights and procedural integrity as KTR awaits further developments in his case.

item.title: First HMPV cases in India: Two Bengaluru infants test positive - The Times of India
item.description:
First HMPV Cases Reported in India: Two Infants in Bengaluru Test Positive

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

This article discusses the first reported cases of human metapneumovirus (HMPV) in India, specifically in Bengaluru, where two infants have tested positive.

  • HMPV is known to cause respiratory infections.
  • The affected infants are currently receiving treatment and are being monitored.
  • Health officials are urging the public to be vigilant in recognizing symptoms.
  • Awareness campaigns are being planned to educate parents about HMPV.
"It's crucial for parents to watch for respiratory symptoms in their children and seek medical help if necessary."

The emergence of HMPV cases in India highlights the need for heightened awareness and preparedness in handling respiratory infections, particularly among young children.

item.title: 'Emergency' trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut makes a hard-hitting impact as Indira Gandhi as the film promises t - TOI Etimes
item.description:
'Emergency' Trailer 2: Kangana Ranaut's Hard-Hitting Portrayal of Indira Gandhi

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

This long-awaited film, set to release on January 17, 2025, marks the 50th anniversary of India's emergency declaration in 1975. The trailer showcases Kangana's transformation into Indira Gandhi, highlighting the gripping narrative the film promises to deliver.

  • The release was delayed due to censor board issues but has now received a U/A certification with suggested cuts.
  • The trailer depicts how Gandhi declared an 'Emergency' in India, emphasizing her powerful dialogue.
  • Kangana expressed gratitude for finally bringing this significant story to the big screen, especially as it resonates with current themes.
  • The film features Anupam Kher, Shreyas Talpade, and Milind Soman among others.
Kangana Ranaut: "This story isn't just about a controversial leader; it delves into themes that remain profoundly relevant today."

Overall, 'Emergency' aims to not only tell a historical tale but also provoke reflection on constitutional resilience.
